body_html:
@peterjc123
I have trouble using pyTorch 0.3.0 with Titan-V [ but not with Titan-X] and am seeking your help.

I have installed pyTorch 0.3.0 using conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch cuda90 and run pyTorch inside a Jupyter notebook without a problem when on Titan-X.

But on Titan-V, the GPU is corrected recognized [that is, "torch.cuda.get_device_name(0)" returned Titan-V], but the input data could not be moved to GPU.
More specifically, when I tried to move my data to GPU using input.cuda(), the Jupyter notebook got hung and froze [ you know [*] continues] . I wrapped the tensor with Variable and did .cuda() and got the same results. Both floats and integers produced the same problem.

Can you guess why or how to get out of this trouble ?
